ftpServer

    • java.lang.Thread
      • ftpServer.Worker

    public class Worker
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class for a FTP server worker thread.

    Moritz Stueckler (SID 20414726)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Worker

        public Worker(java.net.Socket client,
              int dataPort)
        Create new worker with given client socket
        Parameters:
        client - the socket for the current client
        dataPort - the port for the data connection

    • Method Detail

      • closeDataConnection

        private void closeDataConnection()
        Close previously established data connection sockets and streams

      • debugOutput

        private void debugOutput(java.lang.String msg)
        Debug output to the console. Also includes the Thread ID for better readability.
        Parameters:
        msg - Debug message

      • executeCommand

        private void executeCommand(java.lang.String c)
        Main command dispatcher method. Separates the command from the arguments and dispatches it to single handler functions.
        Parameters:
        c - the raw input from the socket consisting of command and arguments

      • handleCwd

        private void handleCwd(java.lang.String args)
        Handler for CWD (change working directory) command.
        Parameters:
        args - New directory to be created

      • handleEpsv

        private void handleEpsv()
        Handler for EPSV command which initiates extended passive mode. Similar to PASV but for newer clients (IPv6 support is possible but not implemented here).

      • handleFeat

        private void handleFeat()
        Handler for the FEAT (features) command. Feat transmits the abilities/features of the server to the client. Needed for some ftp clients. This is just a dummy message to satisfy clients, no real feature information included.

      • handleMkd

        private void handleMkd(java.lang.String args)
        Handler for the MKD (make directory) command. Creates a new directory on the server.
        Parameters:
        args - Directory name

      • handleNlst

        private void handleNlst(java.lang.String args)
        Handler for NLST (Named List) command. Lists the directory content in a short format (names only)
        Parameters:
        args - The directory to be listed

      • handlePass

        private void handlePass(java.lang.String password)
        Handler for PASS command. PASS receives the user password and checks if it's valid.
        Parameters:
        password - Password entered by the user

      • handlePasv

        private void handlePasv()
        Handler for PASV command which initiates the passive mode. In passive mode the client initiates the data connection to the server. In active mode the server initiates the data connection to the client.

      • handlePort

        private void handlePort(java.lang.String args)
        Handler for the PORT command. The client issues a PORT command to the server in active mode, so the server can open a data connection to the client through the given address and port number.
        Parameters:
        args - The first four segments (separated by comma) are the IP address. The last two segments encode the port number (port = seg1*256 + seg2)

      • handlePwd

        private void handlePwd()
        Handler for PWD (Print working directory) command. Returns the path of the current directory back to the client.

      • handleQuit

        private void handleQuit()
        Handler for the QUIT command.

      • handleRetr

        private void handleRetr(java.lang.String file)
        Handler for the RETR (retrieve) command. Retrieve transfers a file from the ftp server to the client.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to transfer to the user

      • handleRmd

        private void handleRmd(java.lang.String dir)
        Handler for RMD (remove directory) command. Removes a directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - directory to be deleted.

      • handleStor

        private void handleStor(java.lang.String file)
        Handler for STOR (Store) command. Store receives a file from the client and saves it to the ftp server.
        Parameters:
        file - The file that the user wants to store on the server

      • handleSyst

        private void handleSyst()

      • handleType

        private void handleType(java.lang.String mode)
        Handler for the TYPE command. The type command sets the transfer mode to either binary or ascii mode
        Parameters:
        mode - Transfer mode: "a" for Ascii. "i" for image/binary.

      • handleUser

        private void handleUser(java.lang.String username)
        Handler for USER command. User identifies the client.
        Parameters:
        username - Username entered by the user

      • nlstHelper

        private java.lang.String[] nlstHelper(java.lang.String args)
        A helper for the NLST command. The directory name is obtained by appending "args" to the current directory
        Parameters:
        args - The directory to list
        Returns:
        an array containing names of files in a directory. If the given name is that of a file, then return an array containing only one element (this name). If the file or directory does not exist, return nul.

      • openDataConnectionActive

        private void openDataConnectionActive(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                                      int port)
        Connect to client socket for data connection. Used for active mode.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - Client IP address to connect to
        port - Client port to connect to

      • openDataConnectionPassive

        private void openDataConnectionPassive(int port)
        Open a new data connection socket and wait for new incoming connection from client. Used for passive mode.
        Parameters:
        port - Port on which to listen for new incoming connection

      • parseExtendedArguments

        private java.lang.String parseExtendedArguments(java.lang.String extArg)
        Helper method to parse the arguments of the EXXX commands (e.g. EPRT). EXXX commands are newer and support IPv6 (not supported here). The arguments get translated back to a "regular" argument.
        Parameters:
        extArg - The extended argument
        Returns:
        The regular argument

      • run

        public void run()
        Run method required by Java thread model
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • sendDataMsgToClient

        private void sendDataMsgToClient(java.lang.String msg)
        Send a message to the connected client over the data connection.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to be sent

      • sendMsgToClient

        private void sendMsgToClient(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a message to the connected client over the control connection. Flushing is automatically performed by the stream.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message that will be sent
